channel.title: Error
channel.description:
guys i need some help my java doesnt work on windows 8 so when i open my runserver or my client it sais :
java is not recognised as on inernal or external command
what do i do on my windows 8 to prevent that from happening it worked on my grandmas windows 8 but it wont work on mine please help me

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

Like everyone here said ur have to change ur classpath.
Just find ur java files and change the path in runserver.
If u realy cant figure it out i can help through skype with teamviewer.

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I don’t have Windows 8, but I assume they didn’t change it.

[center]Setting up your Environmental Variables[/center]

Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java, without it you would simple get ‘The path is not yet specified’ so this is an extremely important step. We will firstly open ‘My Computer’ and click ‘View System Information’. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says ‘Advanced’ and at the bottom, click ‘Environmental Variables’. Now what you’re going to do, is go to your ‘Path’ and ‘Classpath’ variables and edit them.

In your Classpath variable, you’re going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be;

Though if a newer version comes out, you would change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to the newest version.

After you have done the Classpath variable, you’re going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.

The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you’re going to change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to your current version.[/center]

Read full topic

You have to set your environmental variables again.
